articles.title: About
articles.contents:
Øyvind Bruer-Skarsbø
Carl F. Corneil
I have been working with labour market statistics and business statistics for 5 years at Statistics Norway. I also have a special interest in tools related visualizations, such as R and Power BI.
Been at SSB for 6 months, Culture and Media statistics. Background in programming (python, web), film making and design.

articles.title: ESTP-course in BI with Power BI
articles.description: Information about the ESTP-webinar on Power BI held on the 20.-22. april 2021.
articles.contents:
Contents
Introduction
1. Installation
1.2 Recommended settings

2. Resources
2.1 What is Power BI?
2.2 Fundamentals Power BI and data visualization
2.5 Themes and sharing JSON-files
2.6 Import data from Eurostat API using a custom connector
2.7 Import NACE-codelist from Eurostat
2.7 Import data from SSBs APIs - Import data from KLASS
2.8 Import data from STATBANK
2.9 Visualize with Python and Seaborn





Introduction
This course/webinar is intended for newcomers to Power BI, who want to learn more about how to use a business intelligence tool like Power BI to visualize data. The course is also geared towards the type of data ususally seen in the production of official statistics.
1. Installation
The only prerequisite for attending the course is that you have Power BI Desktop installed on a computer that is at your disposal during the 3-day course. We will only use the Desktop-software, which is free, so there is no need to install anything more. Please download the latest version.
1.2 Recommended settings
We recommend to choose the following settings in Power BI desktop:
Set english as the language.
Security > Allow Data Extensions
2. Resources
2.1 What is Power BI?
This video gives you a nice introduction to what Power BI is:


2.2 Fundamentals Power BI and data visualization
Power BIs platform for sharing reports
2.5 Themes and sharing JSON-files


Documentation: Use report themes in Power BI Desktop
2.6 Import data from Eurostat API using a custom connector


Download the connector .mez-file: press download on this page"
Make a folder here: ‘C:\Users\[username]\Documents\Microsoft Power BI Desktop\Custom Connectors’
Add the .mez-file in the folder
Change setting in Power BI > Security > Allow Data Extensions, restart Power BI
2.7 Import NACE-codelist from Eurostat
2.7 Import data from SSBs APIs - Import data from KLASS


ssb.no/en/klass/
Browse to the variant or correspondance you are after
Note id at the end of the URL
Change the code to reflect the ID, or maybe klassType to “variants” / “versions” etc.
Check the documentation of the API: data.ssb.no/api/klass"

Code to paste under: “Get data > Blank query > Advanced Editor”
2.8 Import data from STATBANK




ssb.no/en/statbank
Find the ID of the table you want to get info from
Expand the “API-query box” at the bottom of the page after following the whole web-interface.
You might have to replace single double-quotes, with double double-quotes.

Code to paste under: Get data > Blank query > Advanced Editor



Working example of Python-script for getting a statbank table.
2.9 Visualize with Python and Seaborn
